Text.Value: Raphael has something I want. Help me find it.
Watch your back, now.
I don't fear Raphael.
What are you doing here?
Myself and Hope have formed an alliance. We're going to get out of here.
Hope is your sister?
How did your sister come to be trapped here?
Raphael offered her the world; she didn't want it. He sweetened the deal; she said no. No matter how many times he upped the ante, she just laughed in his face. He didn't like that.
Unlike you, I don't have a death wish. Or an eternal torment wish.
Might want to steer clear of my sister Hope, though. She's mad as a march hare. If she'd just agreed to serve Raphael, he'd probably have released her a long time ago.
Don't you? I thought you had half a brain. Then again, you're here. Pretty much disproves any good sense you might've had, once upon a time.
Poor, deluded Hope. She's stubborn. Raphael loves stubborn. If she'd just agree to serve him, he'd probably have released her a long time ago.
How can you bring yourself to serve your sister's tormentor?
I don't trust her any more than I trust you.
I'm craftier than you think - I already convinced the Archivist that I belong here.
He's going to notice you nosing around in his house. I hope you're ready to face a very angry devil.
As things stand, she's his favourite toy. We're all mad here, but Hope in hell? Why, that's the definition of insanity.

EditorData.NodeContext: Complicated feelings. Both jealous of Raphael's attention and sad because she knows her sister doesn't want it.

Text.Value: Excellent! A scheme of lunatics, a conspiracy of fools. I can't wait to see how it ends - with extreme violence and a hint of grotesque farce, I suspect.

EditorData.NodeContext: Complicated feelings. Both jealous of Raphael's attention and sad because she knows her sister doesn't want it.

Text.Value: You want my advice? Enjoy whatever life remains to you. When Raphael catches you, you'll never enjoy anything again.
Can't resist the faintest hint of a temptation, can you? I suppose that makes two of us.
She is. Though we've got about as much in common as a princess and a pauper.
Hardly a challenge. Your little ploy gave him an excuse to cross-check lots of paperwork - enough to keep him happy for months.
The stubborn ass has endured more torment than any soul should be able to. Even when he took all of her skin, she held onto hope.
That little disguise Hope gave you is adorable. I can see right through it, of course, and so will Raphael.
I ought to start giving you more credit.
I'm surprised you're bold enough to show your face here. Raphael might tear it clean off your skull.
Eventually, he took her by force. Trapped her and swore he wouldn't let her go 'til she gave him what he wanted. Conversion.
Why don't you run off and tell him, Korilla? You love tattling to daddy, don't you?
The only thing that'll keep Raphael happy is dismantling you, piece by piece.
Raphael finds that puzzling. And he loves puzzles. You being here is another puzzle - you don't seem like you want to die.
Me? This is home base. I'm not even going to ask what you're doing here. Plausible deniability.
Leave.

Synopsis: Players can talk to Korrilla in House of Hope and discuss their appearance in Raphael's home
